22  
23  import ca.uhn.fhir.jpa.entity.Search;
24  
25  import java.util.Collection;
26  import java.util.Date;
27  import java.util.Optional;
28  
29  public interface ISearchCacheSvc {
30  
31  	/**
32  	 * Places a new search of some sort in the cache, or updates an existing search. The search passed in is guaranteed to have
33  	 * a {@link Search#getUuid() UUID} so that is a good candidate for consistent identification.
34  	 *
35  	 * @param theSearch The search to store
36  	 * @return Returns a copy of the search as it was saved. Callers should use the returned Search object for any further processing.
37  	 */
38  	Search save(Search theSearch);
39  
40  	/**
41  	 * Fetch a search using its UUID. The search should be fully loaded when it is returned (i.e. includes are fetched, so that access to its
42  	 * fields will not cause database errors if the current tranaction scope ends.
43  	 *
44  	 * @param theUuid The search UUID
45  	 * @return The search if it exists
46  	 */
47  	Optional<Search> fetchByUuid(String theUuid);
48  
49  	/**
50  	 * TODO: this is perhaps an inappropriate responsibility for this service
51  	 *
52  	 * <p>
53  	 * This method marks a search as in progress, but should only allow exactly one call to do so across the cluster. This
54  	 * is done so that if two client threads request the next page at the exact same time (which is unlikely but not
55  	 * impossible) only one will actually proceed to load the next results and the other will just wait for them
56  	 * to arrive.
57  	 *
58  	 * @param theSearch The search to mark
59  	 * @return This method should return an empty optional if the search was not marked (meaning that another thread
60  	 * succeeded in marking it). If the search doesn't exist or some other error occurred, an exception will be thrown
61  	 * instead of {@link Optional#empty()}
62  	 */
63  	Optional<Search> tryToMarkSearchAsInProgress(Search theSearch);
64  
65  	/**
66  	 * Look for any existing searches matching the given resource type and query string.
67  	 * <p>
68  	 * This method is allowed to perofrm a "best effort" return, so it can return searches that don't match the query string exactly, or
69  	 * which have a created timestamp before <code>theCreatedAfter</code> date. The caller is responsible for removing
70  	 * any inappropriate Searches and picking the most relevant one.
71  	 * </p>
72  	 *
73  	 * @param theResourceType The resource type of the search. Results MUST match this type
74  	 * @param theQueryString  The query string. Results SHOULD match this type
75  	 * @param theQueryStringHash The query string hash. Results SHOULD match this type
76  	 * @param theCreatedAfter Results SHOULD not include any searches created before this cutoff timestamp
77  	 * @return A collection of candidate searches
78  	 */
79  	Collection<Search> findCandidatesForReuse(String theResourceType, String theQueryString, int theQueryStringHash, Date theCreatedAfter);
80  
81  	/**
82  	 * Mark a search as having been "last used" at the given time. This method may (and probably should) be implemented
83  	 * to work asynchronously in order to avoid hammering the database if the search gets reused many times.
84  	 *
85  	 * @param theSearch The search
86  	 * @param theDate   The "last returned" timestamp
87  	 */
88  	void updateSearchLastReturned(Search theSearch, Date theDate);
89  
90  	/**
91  	 * This is mostly public for unit tests
92  	 */
93  	void flushLastUpdated();
94  
95  	/**
96  	 * This method will be called periodically to delete stale searches. Implementations are not required to do anything
97  	 * if they have some other mechanism for expiring stale results other than manually looking for them
98  	 * and deleting them.
99  	 */
100 	void pollForStaleSearchesAndDeleteThem();
101 }
